alert.note: Alert for Mercer (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 29 at 11:40AM EDT until May 29 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...River flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia and southeast West Virginia, including the following counties, in southwest Virginia, Giles. In southeast West Virginia, Mercer. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of the East River, as well as along creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations feeding into the river, is imminent. All rivers and streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1134 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms earlier this morning. Flooding is expected during early afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oakvale and Willowton. - For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
